name: B-52
description: Believed to have originated in the 1970 by a bartender and fan of the iconic band, the B-52 is classic guilty pleasure armed with three liqueurs.
directions: Layer the three spirits in a shot glass in the order they're listed.

name: Kamikaze
description: The combination of vodka, lime juice and orange liqueur is served ice-cold as a shot and consumed, more often than not, in less time than it takes to assemble.
directions: Add all the ingredients into a shaker with ice, and shake thoroughly until well-chilled. Double-strain into two shot glasses. Makes 2 shots.

name: Whiskey Sour
description: This 1850s classic predates many of todayâ€™s most beloved cocktails, from the Daiquiri to the Margarita. But they all owe a tip of the cap to the three-ingredient OG, the Whiskey Sour.
directions: Add all the ingredients into a shaker and dry-shake (no ice). Add ice and shake again until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe. Top with 3-5 drops of Angostura bitters.

name: Traditional Old Fashioned
description: So popular they named a glass after it, this whiskey cocktail is a classic go-to.
directions: Fill a mixing glass with ice, and add all of the ingredients. Stir until chilled and diluted, and strain into an Old Fashioned glass with fresh ice. Garnish with an expressed orange peel and 2 cherries.
